termEntry.descrip: Certain packages are dependent on other packages, such as shared libraries. If the required packages are not available, the package cannot be installed. In addition to dependencies (package requirements) that must be fulfilled, certain packages recommend other packages. These recommended packages are only installed if they are actually available, otherwise they are ignored and the package recommending them is installed nevertheless.
A Linux kernel technology used to safely and efficiently extend the capabilities of the kernel without requiring to change kernel source code or load kernel modules.
An observability framework and toolkit designed to create and manage telemetry data such as traces, metrics, and logs from cloud native applications and infrastructure.

a complex set of electronic circuitry that runs the machine’s operating system and apps. The CPU interprets, processes and executes instructions, most often from the hardware and software programs running on the device.
an XML configuration file needed for the installation of YaST (usually named autoinst.xml )

a configuration description for a single system. It consists of sets of resources with properties including support for complex structures such as lists, records, trees and large embedded or referenced objects.

the hardware in a computing device that provides temporary storage for the operating system (OS), software programs and any other data in current use, so they are quickly available to the device's processor

a unique 64-bit or 128-bit identifier assigned to a storage device based on its manufacturer. World Wide Names are used in storage area networks (SAN) (such as Fibre Channel (FC) and Fibre Channel over Ethernet (FCoE) environments) to properly identify and address devices.
a type of semiconductor memory that is typically used for the data or program code needed by a computer processor to function
a framework that provides a mechanism for various security checks to be hooked by new kernel extensions.
an infrastructure as code tool that enables you to safely and predictably provision and manage infrastructure in any cloud

the package manager for Kubernetesthat helps install and manage applications. Helm uses charts to define, install and upgrade complex Kubernetes applications

the concept of gaining an understanding of the behavior and performance of applications and systems. Observability starts by collecting system telemetry data, such as logs, metrics and traces. Attainment % vs the set target of the period
Total ACV of pipeline (Forecast categories: Commit, Upside, Pipeline, Most Likely, Open orders, Closed won) over the target
Total ACV of pipeline opportunities closing in next 3 quarters (excluding current quarter, Forecast categories: Commit, Upside, Pipeline, Most Likely, Open orders, Closed won)

Total ACV of pipeline opportunities closing in current and next 3 quarters compared to the target for the same period (Forecast categories: Commit, Upside, Pipeline, Most Likely, Open orders, Closed won)
Total ACV of pipeline opportunities closing in current and next 3 quarters (Excluding current quarter, forecast categories: Commit, Upside, Pipeline, Most Likely, Open orders, Closed won)

Average Annualized Contract Value (‘aACV’) is defined as the Total Contract Value of a deal divided by the contract duration in years. If duration is less than or equal to one year, aACV = TCV, Stacked SKUs are treated as a unified linked single transaction to determine aACV – start date of first period and end date of last period will be used to determine duration of the transaction
ACV is defined as the Total Invoice Value (TIV) of a deal divided by the invoice duration in years. If invoice duration is less than or equal to 1 year, ACV = TIV (Corporate ACV)
The true quantity of purchased subscriptions, adjusted for proration and for multiple units within a unit (such as 10 Rancher nodes in 1 SKU vs. 1 node in 1 SKU)

AQL is the term used to identify leads that have been qualified or assessed using automation tools or processes. These leads may not have had direct human interaction yet but have exhibited certain behaviors or characteristics that make them potential prospects.

This is a conversion rate of Inquiries (INQs) to Automated Qualified Leads (AQLs). It is done by dividing the INQ volume with AQL volume to find out the conversion rate. The SUSE desired conversion rate for FY24 is 29%
Impact of Customer Success on renewal rates, measured as a % point improvement.

Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) represents the sum of the monthly contractual value for subscriptions and recurring elements of contracts in a given period (monthly recurring revenue MRR), multiplied by 12. Exclusions are - SUSE Engineering products due to their non-recurring nature - 1-month services contracts (Consulting) - NeuVector transactions before January 2022 (pre acquisition)
An estimate of ARR from contracts not billed as of the reporting date. The estimate is based on the historical percentage of ARR from delayed billings (>3 Months lag)
An estimate of ARR from compliance deals not billed as of the reporting date. The estimate is based on a two year lookback of average ARR from compliance bookings.
Average ACV generated from each opportunity

Average Selling Price refers to the Annualized Net Price after discounts have been applied. For example, a 3-year SKU listed at $199 and discounted by 25%: Annual MSRP: $199 / 3 = $66.33 Annual Net Price: $66.33 * (1 – 0.25) = $49.75

Customer Satisfaction score for Engineer once case is closed (5 point scale expressed as %) measured against Case Closed Date. Support Org to be filtered by BCL & ECM. Responses are generated from Support Case Survey that is sent out to the customer once the case is closed.
An existing customer does not renew a product within 12 months but have other active contracts for other products. Notified by Customer of product discontinuation, which is flagged in Salesforce.
New business with compliance flag true. Backdated revenue for non compliant customers.
New business that has this tagging when an existing customer has some new product that differs from the exisiting historical products. SUSE:Rancher / Rancher:SUSE etc. (within a 2 year window)
New business that has this tagging when an existing customer has some new product that sits in the same product family as the historical purchases (within a 2 year window).
Number of enduser customers with active subscriptions or services in a given period.
Number of enduser customers billed in given period.
Discretionary discounts (Special Price Request (SPR) for Volume License Agreement (VLA); SPR and Customer satisfaction discount for Master License Agreement(MLA)).
Additional program benefit for reseller partners that participate in the Deal Registration program. (ie. 12% for Gold 20% for Platinum)

Sum of the booked ACV List Price Total in a fiscal quarter for a given customer. This is a better metric compared to Deal Size (ACV), since this does not factor in the discount and gives a true reflection of the deal size.

There are instances where program, and deal discounts don’t add up 100% to the total discount. Discount modifier is a calculated field to show the remainder, which happens for several reasons: 1. Discount overrides in salesforce – for example Program Discount Override changes the total discount amount, but not the program discount (causing a discrepency). 2. Incomplete data in salesforce – while total discount is List Price minus Final Price, we don’t always have the full waterfall populated in salesforce to differentiate between discount types. This is more common on older quotes (pre FY22). 3. Different final price between the invoice and quote – discount may add up on the quote, however there is a different final price on the invoice. The total discount is calculated using the final price billed to the customer (not quotes).
Decrease in quantity or change in discount for lower price at time of renewal purchase. Contract renewal duration less than 12 months.
Volume of Support cases that are open at a point in time. This is measured on daily basis and is available from FY 2022.
Total ACV of booked orders for the past quarters in fiscal year + forecast of remaining quarters over the target

tig.term: Fiscal year ACV forecast vs target

termEntry.descrip: Standard program discount given to the customer or partner. Discount levels vary by program. Within a program, discounts may also vary by GEO/region/country, vertical segments, distributor, support level, and subscription vs service. Please see the latest SUSE Buying & Pricing Guide for detailed information on program discounts.
Calculating how accurately the forecast was made based of the week 4 call in the quarter vs the actuals at the end of the quarter by Geo and regional level.
Statutory revenue Excluding aquired deferred revenue adjustments measured at budget/plan/mixed rate
Third party discount given to the fulfillment agents (typically 5% after the standard discount has been applied; not 5% off the list price.

Ratio of Support cases where first response Service Level Agreement (SLA) was completed by total number of Support cases. Only cases with FR SLAs are taken into account (using milestones). This is calculated based on Support case created date.

tig.term: Support Case First Response SLA Attainment

termEntry.descrip: At this stage, prospects have shown some interest in interacting with web and digital content and want to learn more. Here, potential customers are actively considering our products and comparing it to alternatives. They have not shown any intent to buy, nor provided personal details.

Written confirmation (MLA) or once a Customer unresponsive to renewal sales efforts (VLA). (Customer does not purchase expiring contract within 12 months of previous contract expiration, and has no other active contracts.) No longer an active customer.
New business with no histories >5k in a 2 year window, and the new business is also <5k (total order) sits in "Low Spend" until they get buy >5k at some point which would trigger "Net New".

Sales framework that helps the sales team to qualify and manage complex deals by focusing on key areas: Metrics (value of your solution), Economic Buyer (decision-maker), Decision Criteria (customer's needs), Decision Process (buying steps), Paper Process (contractual steps), Identify Pain (customer's problems), Champion (internal advocate), and Competition (other options). It ensures alignment with the customer's needs and improves the chances of closing deals successfully.

MQLs are leads that have been assessed by ISR/MDR teams and are deemed to be more likely to become customers compared to other leads. This determination is made based on specific qualification criteria, PANT(Pain, Authority, Need, Timeline). MQLs are passed on to the sales team for Qualification.
This is a conversion rate of AQLs to MQLs. It is done by dividing the AQL volume with MQL volume to find out the conversion rate. The SUSE desired conversion rate for FY24 is 6%.
Monthly Recurring Revenue represents the Sum of the monthly contractual value for subscriptions and recurring elements of contracts in a given period
New business, no history in 2 year window, and the total order value is >5k, the order will be classed as "Net New".
Number of days an opportunity stays open before closing. For open opportunities the age is calculated by taking current date - creation date of opportunity

Total ACV of pipeline created in a specific period (Forecast categories: Commit, Upside, Pipeline, Most Likely, Open orders, Closed won): for example; to learn pipeline created in the last quarter - run a report on 01st of the new quarter to see all opportunities created in the quarter

Health of the Sales Pipeline indicated by a collection of metrics. For example: Identify and flag opportunities with close date in past, Renewal opportunities with zero values, Commit opportunities need approvals.

Number of unique product portfolios booked per deal. The goal is to track how well we are doing in terms of product diversity at time of booking & how it differs amongst geo's, verticals, sales reps, programs, etc.
Number of Support cases created during a period of time. This is measured against case created date.
Price captured vs the associated list price (opposite of a discount)

Customer Satisfaction score for Product Quality once support case closed (5 point scale expressed as %) measured against Case Closed Date. Support Org to be filtered by BCL & ECM. Responses are generated from Support Case Survey that is sent out to the customer once the case is closed.
Sum of all pre-agreed discounts with the customer and partner.
Customer repurchases expiring contract within 12 months of previous contract expiration.

Total expiring ACV value of Expiring Service Contracts within a Financial Year (1st November to 31st October).
All end user subscription business should be renewable including services, premium support, subscription maint SKU’s Consulting and training services are not renewable as they are not a subscription. IHV, CSP, Embedded are not currently considered tracked as renewable and are therefore categorised as new Exceptions may be under UNIQUE program, which requires order entry team review to determine whether should be in renewal pool

Renewed ACV divided by Renewal pool relating to a specific Quarter or 4 Quarters, expressed as a percentage. Run over following time periods: On time – Renewal rate in expiring quarter of deal, run immediately after that Qtr. Qtr in arrears – Renewal rate including slipped deals in following quarter, run a Qtr arrears. Rolling 4 Quarter – Renewal rate covering 12 months, run immediately after a Qtr (would exclude slipped deals from most recent Qtr).
Volume of critical Support cases including name of customer, link to defects, days open, support engineer

Sales ACV is defined as the Total Invoice Value (TIV) of a deal closed in the reporting period fiscal year divided by the associated invoice duration in years. If invoice duration is less than or equal to 1 year, ACV = TIV.
FP&A revenue excluding SAP royalty deductions
Sales Velocity is a metric that provides insights into how quickly sales team is generating revenue. (ACV per day)

Customer Satisfaction score for Support Experience once case closed (5 point scale expressed as %) measured against Case Closed Date. Support Org to be filtered by BCL & ECM. Responses are generated from Support Case Survey that is sent out to the customer once the case is closed.
Case Age of all closed Support cases measured against case closed date

The $ attainment of the pre-defined renewal pool for the specified period. This rate is derived as a percentage of $ renewed from the $ Renewal Pool. The renewal rate can change post-period end, in case a renewal comes in late (is slipped)
Per $ product how much $ services attached to that sale. This is a percentage of Services $ of Product $

SQOs are leads that have been reviewed and approved by the sales team as ready for direct sales engagement, and promoted from a lead to an opportunity by the Account Owner. This means they have expressed a clear intent to purchase, have the budget, and are a good fit for the product.
This is a conversion rate of MQLs to SQOs. It is done by dividing the MQL volume with SQO volume to find out the conversion rate. The SUSE desired conversion rate for FY24 is 100 % or less
Revenue recognised under IFRS15, for external reporting to markets government financial insititutions, measure at actual conversion rates to USD
Revenue recognised under IFRS15, for external reporting to markets government financial insititutions, measure at actual conversion rates to USD
Total contracted amount of a deal, including contractually binding agreements for future invoicing with a purchase order in SUSE systems.
Total invoiced amount of a deal, which excludes any future contractually binding agreements for future invoicing e.g. if a booking has no PO for future years this is excluded
Sum of all program and deal discounts, and overrides/modifiers ( \details coming soon on overrides).
Order is tagged as "Upsell" if they buy a product that already has an active contract or the same product history in a 2 year window. Buying more of the same.
Renewed contract that has increased value through price increase and/or discount reduction from prior contract.

Utilization is calculated on quarterly basis by hours, 2080 hours annually is the standard available hours (demoninator) for all consultants globally. Includes time spent by a consultant on billable and non-billable activities tracked as task categories
These 3 KPIs break down the changes in ACV to explain how much is driven by volume, price changes or mix changes.

Total ACV number call made by the owner the quota. For ex - Account executive will make their call, Managers will make their call and regional managers and GM's will make their call of ACV on a weekly basis for the current quarter / next quarter
Total global TCV forecast for the current quarter aggregated from the weekly submissions by Geo GMs including their judgment

Calculated global forecast that applies weights to each opportunity based on its respective Forecast Category. Weights applied as follows: Booked 100%, Commit & Open Orders 90%, Most Likely 60%, Upside 20%, Pipeline 0%

ACV value of a deal we expect to be renewed, if the deal duration is more than 12 months it will be the final 12 months ACV value. Metric is used to calculate sales rep quotas and the renewal pool for a fiscal period
Headcount (HC) is the umber of people employed on the last day of previous month, excluding RGS & contractors and temporary staff
Number of external hires per month based on start date
Total number of leavers including voluntary & involuntary
Number of leavers expressed as percentage
Number of people with a Promotion Action Reason in Workday
Number of external hires per month based on Actual Start Date from Recruitment Reports
Average Number of Days taken to fill per the Number Of Candidates Hired

Subscription active period is considered based on the subscription start and end date (settlement start and end date) Susbcriptions count is based on the quantity of the ordered SKUs for specific customer.
Each system has registry date, last seen date and system updated date. A system is considered active if there are 360 days or less past between todays date and the system last seen date.
Average sockets per system is calculated based on the total sockets of a system, divided by the number of not virtualized systems.
Virtual central processing unit. One or more vCPUs are assigned to every Virtual Machine (VM) within a cloud environment.
Average memory is calculated in GB and it is equal to the total system memory divided by the number ot not virtualized systems. Not virtualized systems are the ones where virtualized flag is false.
Average memory per VM is calculated in GB and it is equal to the total system memory divided by the number of virtualized systems.
Avg Memeory per socket is measured in GB. It is calculated by dividing the total systems memory by the amount of sockets.
Avg Memory per vCPUs is calculated in GB. It shows how many vCPUs we have on average by dividing the vCPUs by number or VMs.

This calculation is combining the number of very negative, negative, neutral, positive and very positive responses and it is multipying the number of the responses by the specific sentiment score (-2, -1, 0, 1 or 2)
An instance is calculation based on the usage hours information for each machine in 24 hours. If the customer is consuming 30 hours for a day, it is calculated that this customer has 2 instances.
% and $ renewal uplift from FY25 base plan. This is a metric to measure the impact of observability on our Rancher Prime business. The FY25 plan was developed before the StackState acquisition.
Observability Add-on to Rancher Prime customers - % of active customers purchasing the Add-on SKU
ACV of New customer to Rancher in last 2 years purchasing Rancher Prime
Conversion rate of free users to Rancher Prime
Driving users / potential customers to the community SaaS

An Account Executive in Salesforce (SFDC) is responsible for managing a portfolio of end-user accounts, identify new business opportunities, and ensure customer satisfaction through strategic account management and pipeline development.
Subscriber contract with end-date in future.
Unique lead with a score at or above 50 pts will then be assigned to relevant lead queue or individual for follow-up
Average amount billed late in a period calculated as the average of the total ARR over the 12 month period
Attainment is a key performance indicator (KPI) used to evaluate progress or achievement against set goals, targets, or objectives within a given period.
Recorded and approved billable hours worked by the employee

tig.term: Recognized hours, Posted hours, Hours Applied

termEntry.descrip: The process of issuing an invoice or charging a customer for product or services provided.
Booking refers to the confirmed value of contracts or orders secured with customers, representing the revenue expected to be generated and recorded in financial systems.
Booking refers to the confirmed value of contracts or orders secured with customers, representing the revenue expected to be generated and recorded in financial systems
Business is an economic activity that involves the exchange, purchase, sale or production of goods and services with a motive to earn profits and satisfy the needs of customers.
BCL is Business Core Linux Products. This are all SUSE Products.
Net new lead in SFDC that has not been converted to a contact
Excel file that enables marketers to upload leads into Marketo and Salesforce

BYOS is a model that allows customers to bring their own software licenses to use with cloud-based infrastructure or services. It enables customers to leverage their existing software investments in the cloud.

Case refers to the ticket that the customer submits to the vendor (SUSE) that describes the issue the customer is facing. It includes information such a severity of the issue and what product is it related to.

A closed deal refers to the successful completion of a sales transaction or agreement. In business and sales contexts, it typically means that all terms have been agreed upon, contracts have been signed, and the sale is finalized.
A company that offers cloud-based services, platforms, and resources over the internet. Examples include Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform (GCP)

Committed spend refers to committing a certain amount of money or resources upfront to a cloud service provider in exchange for discounted prices. This is often used to secure a reduced rate for cloud services over a specified contract period.
Compliance deal is finding of unpaid usages that are made by customers.
The Compliance flag on an opportunity that allows to report on compliance revenue associated with the compliance deals in SFDC. Program code and SKU signifies the compliance data.
Employees belonging to the consultant organisation (excluding Trainers and Premium Engineers)
Either a Lead that has been convertedor an existing contact manually added usually by sales to Salesforce.
Existing contact that has re-engaged with SUSE and is being followed-up like a business lead.

A contract is a legally binding agreement between two or more parties that outlines the terms and conditions of their relationship, rights, and obligations. They are enforceable by law, meaning if one party does not fulfill its obligations, the other party can seek legal remedies.

Contract Action in Salesforce (SFDC) indicates whether a customer contract is in a "New" status, requiring initial setup and activation, or "Renewal," where the focus is on extending the existing agreement and maintaining continuous service without interruption.
Time duration between earliest start date and latest end date for all product lines within a contract.
Contractual Value is the total amount of money agreed upon in a customer contract for the products or services provided over the contract's duration, used to assess expected revenue.
This is a conversion rate of INQ to AQL (AQL/MQL or MQL/SQO). It is done by dividing the first critiria volume with the second critiria volume to find out the conversion rate.
Fully loaded headcount cost of consultant delivering consulting engagement, and any other expenses incurred during engagement
The Chief Revenue Officer (CRO) is an executive-level position responsible for overseeing all revenue-generating activities within a company.
A cloud service provider is a third-party company offering a cloud-based platform, infrastructure, application, or storage services.

tig.term: Cloud Service Provider, also referred to as Hyperscalers.

termEntry.descrip: A company already buying from SUSE

Customer type is a classification of customers based on value of their latest contract. Different customer types are Compliance, Cross Sell -Other Business, Cross Sell - Same Business, Low spend,Net New, Renewal, Upsell
A deal is an agreement or arrangement between two or more parties for the exchange of products, services, or financial assets.
Deal size is total value associated with a specific transaction or business deal.
Request For Enhancement: A request by Customer to add functionality or enhance performance beyond the specifications of the Service and are not included as part of Support Services
A defect is an unexpected problem with application that was not anticipated by the developer.

Deferred revenue is an advance payment for products or services that are to be delivered or performed in the future.Deferred income is, money received for goods or services which has not yet been earned. According to the revenue recognition principle, it is recorded as a liability until delivery is made, at which time it is converted into revenue.
A discount is a reduction in the original price of a product or service, offered to customers to encourage purchases or provide savings.
Discount(approved) is a price reduction that has been authorized by a person with the necessary authority.
Discount value refers to the amount or percentage by which the original price of a product or service is reduced.
Discount volume refers to a pricing strategy in which customers receive a discount based on the quantity or volume of goods or services they purchase.
A Distributor is a business entity that purchases products directly from manufacturers and then resells them to retailers, wholesalers, or even directly to end consumers.
An end-user is a consumer who uses a product and/or service.The end-user is the final customer in the supply chain, the one for whom the product or service is designed and intended.
These are all Rancher,Harvester, Longhorn, NeuVector Products.
Top 700 business critical Linux install base customers. Criteria to be an Enterprise account is to have $100K+ ARR or BCL Renewal of $100K+

First Response Time (FRT) is the time elapsed between a customer raising a ticket (or contacting the vendor) and an agent first responding to it. A baseline FRT is added in service level agreements (SLA), which means they must respond to customers within a specified timeframe. If not then a penalty is imposed on the vendor.
Indicates that the account is listed within the Forbes 2000 list of biggest companies in the world. Sales Ops manually populates this field.
Forecast is the process of predicting or estimating future trends, events, or outcomes based on historical data, current conditions, and analytical techniques.

A General Manager (GM) is a senior-level executive responsible for overseeing the day-to-day operations of a business unit,leading teams, achieving business goals, and ensuring overall organizational success.

The next geographical level down from Global or world-wide, we currently operate within the following Geos: North America (NA), Europe Middle East and Africa (EMEA), Asia Pacific (including Greater China) APAC), Latin America (Latam), Federal (FED) [MD10] [MG11]
Global System Integrators – the large global consulting companies like Accenture, TCS, Wipro, etc.
Global Services Provider, typically a Hyperscaler (Cloud Service Provider) or IHV partner.
A hidden listing is a product or service available in the cloud marketplace but not publicly visible to all users. It is usually accessible only to specific customers or under certain conditions.
Recorded and potentially not yet approved hours worked by the employee
Incentive and Commission Management, the tool that is used to calculate attainment and commission for participants on the commission plan.
A partner that builds/sells hardware or software, pre-integrated with SUSE Software
Delta between TCV and aACV value of a deal, i.e., the multiyear element of a subscription with a duration of more than 12 months.

Individual Quota Carriers are sales team members who have specific sales targets or goals they are responsible for achieving, based on their own performance and contribution to the overall sales objectives.
Unique lead with a score below 50 pts because it has not yet enough engagement with SUSE to become AQL
The invoice amount is the total sum of money that a customer is required to pay to SUSE for products or services provided.
Inside Sales Representative. Only works leads with priority1 to3

ISR (Inside Sales Representative) is a sales professional who primarily sells products or services remotely, using phone calls, emails, and digital communication tools to engage with potential customers and qualify leads.
The most recent Campaign to be added to a Lead
An individual with a potential interest in SUSE products. The interest is expressed by sharing contact information (name, company, email, phone number) with SUSE.
Calculated dynamically based on the qulity of the lead at the time of AQL. Lead Priority is used for SLA calculations. P1 to P5. Assigned each time a lead becomes an AQL
List price is the basic price set by SUSE for their products or services without discounts.
Roll up of metrics such as ACV, Quota and revenue etc to the next level of hierachy.

A Manager is responsible for overseeing a team or department, guiding team members toward achieving goals, making strategic decisions, managing resources, and ensuring overall performance and operational efficiency.
Identified accounts that have been nominated by the Sales & Marketing teams for special marketing attention this year. This field is manually populated and is not based on Logic.

A cloud marketplace is an online platform provided by cloud service providers that allows customers to discover, procure, and deploy various cloud-based services and software solutions from different vendors in one centralized location.

A Master License Agreement (MLA) is a comprehensive contract between two parties where one party (the licensor i.e SUSE) grants the other party (the licensee) the right to use intellectual property (IP) under specified terms and conditions. This type of agreement covers a licensing terms, often for a suite of SUSE products or services, and is designed to govern the overall relationship between the two parties over time.
Marketing Development Representative. Only works leads with priority 4 & 5
A lead which has been qualified and/or has had a meeting assigned and has been assigned to Sales for follow-up
Unique lead that has been converted to an Opportunity

A Managed Service Provider (MSP) is a company that remotely manages a client's IT infrastructure and end-user systems on a proactive basis, offering services such as network management, cybersecurity, cloud solutions, and technical support to ensure optimal performance and security. It is included under CSP (Cloud Service Provider)
The net amount is the final amount a customer is required to pay after applying discounts, taxes, fees, and other relevant charges to the gross or initial amount.

At the account level, distinguishes if a customer is Pure Net New, ECM customer, BCL customer or ECM & BCL. Pure NNN – has not purchased >$1000 in either BCL or ECM in the past 3 years.
BCL Customer - has only purchased >$1000 BCL products in the past 3 years ie $5000 purchase of BCL, $500 purchase of ECM
ECM Customer has only purchased >$1000 ECM products in the past 3 years ie $5000 purchase of ECM, $500 purchase of BCL
BCL & ECM - has purchased >$1000 BCL products in the past 3 years and has purchased >$1000 ECM products in the past 3 years ie $5000 purchase of BCL, $5000 purchase of ECM
First purchase by new customer or existing customer

Renewals are subscription business that is returning to SUSE after the initial purchase or subsequent renewals, and the initial purchases are defined as new business. During the renewal process any additional quantities of subscriptions sold can be considered new, subject to the renewal base being fully covered.
A Non-Standard Program Discount refers to a reduction in price offered by SUSE to End Users, Reseller or Distributor other than the standard discounts.

In Salesforce (SFDC), an Opportunity represents a potential sales deal or business transaction with a customer or prospect, tracking its progress through various stages in the sales pipeline, from initial contact to closing, to help forecast revenue and manage sales activities.
Opportunities marked as Closed won when the order is completed.
The person provided consent to recieve email communication from SUSE
The person has not provided their consent to recieve email communication from SUSE or has specifically opted-out
A product or service sold to a customer and appearing as a distinct offering on a customer order or invoice
Total value of all products and/or services sold to a customer and appearing as payable amount on a customer order or invoice

Sales roles such as sales specialists, solution architects who works along with the direct sales team and helps in winning the deal. These roles get's assigned overaly quota as part of the support they should provide in winning deals
Resellers, Distributors, OEM, Embedded, Cloud and MSP partners

PAYG is a pricing model commonly used in cloud computing where customers only pay for the resources they actually use. It allows for flexible billing based on consumption, making it cost-effective for businesses with varying workloads.
Profiles of SUSE typical main customers

Pipeline is a visual representation of potential sales opportunities or deals that are in various stages of development within a SUSE's sales process. It helps businesses track and manage their sales activities from the initial lead generation to the closing of the deal.
Pipeline contribution measures the number of opportunities generated by Marketing that convert into sales opportunities.

A legally binding document presented to SUSE sales team by a customer account or contact person containing a list of products/services they want to buy. It lays out the order details, including quantity and types of product(s)/service(s) the customer needs, as well as payment terms and delivery details along with applicable terms and conditions.
Price is the amount of money or other consideration that is required to purchase a product, service, or asset.

A private offer is a negotiated and customized pricing agreement between a cloud service provider and a specific customer. It allows the provider to offer tailored terms, discounts, or special packages to meet the unique requirements of the customer.

At SUSE, a Product refers to a software solution or service offered by the company, such as SUSE Linux Enterprise Server (SLES), SUSE Rancher, or SUSE Manager, designed to support enterprise-level IT environments by providing robust, secure, and scalable open-source platforms for operating systems, container management, cloud services, and infrastructure automation.

A Product Family in a business context, like at SUSE, refers to a group of related products that share common features, functionalities, or target markets. These products are typically categorized together under a broader umbrella to streamline management, sales, and marketing efforts, such as SUSE Linux, Kubernetes Management, and Cloud Solutions.

A Product Portfolio at SUSE refers to the complete range of products and services the company provides, including operating systems like SUSE Linux Enterprise Server, Kubernetes management solutions like SUSE Rancher, and various cloud and edge computing services, all aimed at delivering secure, scalable, and innovative open-source solutions to customers.
Profitability is a measure of a business's profit relative to its expenses.
Proration refers to a subscription payment that has been amended from it's standard term. For example, 12 month subscription prorated to 6 months at half the price.
A lead that hasn't bought from SUSEin the last ... months
A quota is a specific limit or target set on the amount, number, or value of something that can be produced, sold, imported, exported, or achieved within a defined period.
An entry in a CRM system
A Regional Manager is a senior-level leader responsible for overseeing the operations, performance, and strategy of multiple teams within a specific geographic region.
Renewal rate measures the percentage of customers or contracts that are renewed at the end of a subscription period or contract term.
Name of the account that LeanData has matched with the lead. This key field shows to which account the lead belongs.
A reseller is a business or individual that purchases products or services from a manufacturer, distributor, or another vendor and then sells them to end customers.
Reserved Instances are a pricing option where customers can reserve specific virtual machine instances or other cloud resources for a predefined period at a discounted rate.
Revenue referred to here is recognised revenue under IFRS Standards.
Rancher Government Solution – the legal entity that manages the North America Federal Business.

Royalties are business that SUSE earns from its partners selling SUSE subscriptions to their end customers. SUSE will have pre-agreed discounts/price with the partners and the partners report royalties and pay SUSE on a periodic basis.
Royalty revenue is a where the customer self reports usage based on the incluion of SUSE product on there own offerings. Significant examples, Amazon, Microsoft, HPE
Remaining Performance Obligations – Financial Term used for Contracts with future billings, e.g., MY deals with annual installments yet to be invoiced.
Route to Market, includes Direct, Reseller, Cloud, IHV (Independent Hardware Vendor), and Embedded

Customer facing employees in SUSE CRO and CFL organizations have separate roles and responsibilities, which influence the make-up of their respective plans. Typical roles include: Account Executives (AEs), Territory Account Managers (TAMs), Solution Sales Specialists (SSP), Partner Executives (PEs), Solution Architects (Pre-Sales, SAs), Customer Success Managers (CSMs), Inside Sales Representatives (ISRs), Renewal Representatives (RRs), Consultants (CONS), Premium Engineers (Post-Sales, PREs), Subscription Verification (SV), Regional Managers (RMs), Sales Manager (SM), Route to Market Leaders (RTM) and some unique roles.

The SAP Royalty is an charge payable to SAP on all SUSE sales of the Products in the SAP product family(Currently 8.5%) excluding sales to SAP customer. This is recorded net to revenue and is paid on a quarterly basis

At SUSE, a Segment refers to a specific group of customers or market categories that share common characteristics, such as industry, company size, or geographic location. Segments are used to tailor sales, marketing, and service strategies to effectively address the unique needs and challenges of different customer groups, such as enterprise, SMB (small and medium-sized businesses), or specific verticals like healthcare, finance, or telecommunications.
Time duration between settlement start date and settlement end date
SKU stands for Stock Keeping Unit, it is a unique alphanumeric code used to identify a specific product within a company's inventory.

SLA refers to Service Level Agreement. It is an agreement between a service provider and a customer. It defines the aspects of the service – quality, availability, responsibilities that is expected from the vendor (SUSE)
Special Price Request (SPR) is a formal process where a sales team or reseller seeks approval for a discounted price outside the standard pricing model.
Sales Qualified Opportunity. When the lead source is "Marketing", it comes from a marketing lead which has been qualified and converted into a sales opportunity.
Revenue recognised under IFRS15, for external reporting to markets government financial insititutions, measure at actual conversion rates to USD

Subscription business will always have a start and end date to the support obligation that SUSE has committed to deliver to the Customer. SUSE sells its support through different routes, known as routes to markets.
Total business refers to the total revenue or total sales generated by a SUSE over a specific period, such as a month, quarter, or year.
Total contracted amount of a deal, including contractually binding agreements for future invoicing with a purchase order in SUSE systems.

Marketing touchpoints are any types of interaction or points of contact between a person and SUSE. Marketing touchpoints can be physical—like when a customer/prospect attends an event and chats with a salesperson—or virtual, when he downloads an e-book or attend a webinar.

Special URL used by marketers to track the effectiveness of online marketing campaigns. Will provide the info on what is the digital location the user came from, the source of the traffic and the SFDC campaign assocaited.
A segment of customers within a industry such as Telco, Automotive, Healthcare etc. Verticals are not Geo specific.

A Volume License Agreement (VLA) is a contract between a software provider and an organization that allows the organization to purchase and deploy multiple copies of a software product at a discounted price.

Customer Satisfaction Score measures customer satisfaction with a product, support, and engineer. This is obtained by asking questions through a survey that is sent out from Qualtrics, every time a case is closed.

Time to Close refers to the time (in days) it took to close the case (ticket) raised by the customer. This is different from Time to Resolution (TTR) as TTR measures the time it took the support engineer to resolve the case.

MEDDPICC is a sales qualification framework that stands for Metrics, Economic Buyer, Decision Criteria, Decision Process, Identify Pain, Champion, Competition, and Paper Process, used to assess and manage complex B2B sales opportunities.
subscription is a purchasing plan that gives a customer the right to receive technical support, updates and upgrades in which a customer purchases directly or indirectly from SUSE for a SUSE Product.

Systems are machines, computing power that a customer has. Systems can be virtual or physical. VM or Virtual Guest means a virtualized context that can execute e.g. one operating system, workload, application, or multiples of such, like a physical System.
Total number in GBs of memory per system, VM
The socket is a location on the motherboard or other similar computer circuitry where a CPU has been physically installed on a System
vCPU stands for Virtual central processing unit. One or more vCPUs are assigned to every Virtual Machine (VM) within a cloud environment.

Customer feedback responses is the total number of feedback records based. Each customer response can contain multiple topics. While the responses count refers to the total number of individual customer responses, the topics count reflects all the distinct subjects mentioned within those responses.
The sentiment score assigned to each interview topic is ranging from Very Negative (-2) to Very Positive (+2). This helps track overall customer satisfaction trends.
allow dynamic generation of AutoYaST control files
A block-level caching mechanism that uses a fast storage device (like an SSD) to cache data from a slower storage device (like an HDD).

A system for auditing security-relevant events on a Linux system.
Salt formulas provided by SUSE Manager for automating system configuration and management.
a type of memory that retains its contents even when the power is turned off

a caching strategy in which data is first written to a cache and later written to the primary storage (such as main memory or disk) only when necessary

refers to the simulation of human intelligence in machines that are designed to learn and solve problems like humans. Enables computers to understand language, make decisions and improve from experience.
a security measure where a computer network is physically isolated from unsecured networks, including the public Internet

describing a system, network or device that is physically or logically isolated from unsecured networks, including the public Internet, as a security measure to prevent unauthorized access or data breaches

the basic unit of text processing in AI models, representing whole words, subwords, characters or symbols. Models break text into tokens to analyze input and generate output.

a group communication system that provides reliable messaging, membership tracking and quorum information for High Availability clusters

where the user knows the details of the hardware to be deployed to and has direct access to the out-of-band management interface to orchestrate and automate the entire provisioning process.

a Kubernetes operator whose purpose is to create a copy of a Kubernetes Service and Endpoint and to keep them synced.
Actions that can be scheduled to apply the highstate or an arbitrary set of custom states to clients on a specified schedule.

An endpoint in SAML that facilitates the termination of a user's session across multiple service providers and the identity provider.
A sequence of actions to be performed on clients in a specified order, ensuring that actions are executed respecting dependencies or required timings.
A configuration in SUSE Multi-Linux Manager that defines software channel sources, filters for package selection, and build environments for managing the lifecycle of content.
A designated location (like a Docker registry or a file system directory) where images built by SUSE Multi-Linux Manager (container images or OS images) are pushed and stored.

provides a general-purpose, Kubernetes-native upgrade controller (for nodes)

A SUSE Multi-Linux Manager configuration for environments where it is not possible to connect the SUSE Multi-Linux Manager server to the internet.

A feature in SUSE Multi-Linux Manager that allows scheduling actions to occur during a defined period, preventing certain restricted actions outside this window.

a concise manual that guides users through the initial setup or basic use of an IT product. It typically covers essential installation steps, configuration, and first-use instructions to help users become productive quickly.

a hardware or software mechanism that monitors system health and triggers a reset or alert if a failure is detected
Group of integrated Kubernetes worker machines that run in virtual machines on top of a SUSE Virtualization cluster. Guest clusters form the main infrastructure for running container workloads.

Group of integrated physical servers (hosts) on which the SUSE Virtualization hypervisor is installed. These servers collectively manage compute, memory, and storage resources to provide an environment for running virtual machines.
Specialized operating system and software stack that runs on a single physical server.

Physical server on which the SUSE Virtualization hypervisor is installed. Each node that joins a SUSE Virtualization cluster must be assigned a role that determines the functions the node can perform within the cluster. All SUSE Virtualization nodes process data but not all can store data.
Driver that SUSE Rancher Prime uses to provision virtual machines in a SUSE Virtualization cluster, and to launch and manage guest Kubernetes clusters on top of those virtual machines.

tig.descrip: Both 'SUSE Virtualization' and 'Harvester' refer to the open-source, cloud-native HCI solution developed by SUSE. Harvester is the upstream project, and its component names are used in SUSE Virtualization without rebranding. Because of this, you will see the name 'Harvester' in sections of the SUSE Virtualization UI and documentation that involve specific components.

A PolicyReport and a ClusterPolicyReport store results of policy scans. Which one is used, depends on the scope of the resource.
A PolicyReport and a ClusterPolicyReport store results of policy scans. Which one is used depends on the scope of the resource.

A Kubernetes resource created by the Kubewarden controller to let Kubernetes know where to send an AdmissionReview. In other words, this is how a Kubewarden controller informs Kubernetes where to find a resource mutating policy.
A PolicyServer validates incoming requests by executing Kubewarden policies against requests.

A Kubernetes resource created by the Kubewarden controller to let Kubernetes know where to send a AdmissionReview. In other words, this is how Kubewarden informs Kubernetes where to find a resource validating policy.
A binary instruction format for a stack-based virtual machine. Designed for web deployment.

a group of standards-track API specifications for software compiled to the W3C WebAssembly (Wasm) standard. WASI is designed to provide a secure standard interface for applications that can be compiled to Wasm from any language, and that may run anywhere
a protocol for communicating into and out of WebAssembly
a modern hyperconverged infrastructure (HCI) solution built for bare metal servers using enterprise-grade open-source technologies including Linux, KVM, Kubernetes, KubeVirt, and Longhorn

tig.descrip: Both 'SUSE Virtualization' and 'Harvester' refer to the open-source, cloud-native HCI solution developed by SUSE. Use 'SUSE Virtualization' when referring to the paid product. Use 'Harvester' only when referring to the solution that is available to community users.

termEntry.descrip: New customer from any route to market to SUSE Group, defined as new ARR over the past 12 months, for customers without existing contracts in the prior year.
Increase in ARR, due to increased footprint or price increase to an existing customer, based on customer name & route-to-market. Includes an element of accrued ARR and ARR from compliance.
Cross Sell between BCL & ECM solutions. (Split between Cross-Sell New and Cross-Sell Lost)
An estimate of ARR from compliance deals not billed as of the reporting date. The estimate is based on a two year lookback of average ARR from compliance bookings.
Decrease in ARR, due to reduced footprint or price decreases to an existing customer, based on customer name & route-to-market. Includes an element of accrued ARR.
Customer with no ARR at ending period versus starting period, based on customer name & route-to-market.
Measures proportion of ARR retained from existing customers, allowing for the impact of Churn and Downsell, but excluding the benefit of upsell.
Measures proportion of ARR retained from existing customers, including upsell to existing customers.
The actual exchange rate on each day, updated on each dealing day in SAP, used for precise actual calculations and management reporting.
Exchange rates between all transaction currencies and USD, set at the beinning of the financial year. In SUSE they are used to consolidate reporting to USD.
The next fiscal yearâ€™s planrate, only used during year-end closing.
The FX rate for each calendar month applied to the same month in the prior year.

ARR represents the sum of the monthly contractual value for subscriptions and recurring elements of contracts in a given period (MRR), multiplied by 12. ARR Prior Period represents the prior period ARR.
An Enterprise Agreement (EA) is a volume licensing contract that provides businesses with flexible, scalable, and cost-effective access to software or cloud services, typically for a 3-5 year term.
It refers to the complete cost of acquiring, operating, and maintaining an asset or investment over its entire lifecycle.
Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) Operating Costs, representing the total costs associated with full-time operations, including salaries, benefits, and overhead for full-time employees.
OPEX (Operating Expenses) are the ongoing costs a business incurs to run its daily operations, such as salaries, rent, utilities, and maintenance.
CAPEX (Capital Expenditures) are funds used by a business to acquire, upgrade, or maintain long-term assets like property, equipment, or technology.

An intangible asset is a nonphysical asset or resource whose value to a business cannot always be simply recorded on a balance sheet. Examples include business reputation, branding, intellectual property, computer software and unique business processes.

Cloud Savings Plans are flexible pricing models offered by cloud service providers that allow customers to commit to a certain level of usage over a period (usually 1 or 3 years) in exchange for lower rates on cloud services.
Where SUSE sells directly to a customer/End-User or through our reseller/channel partner ecosystem
Customers consuming software solutions through Cloud Service Providers (CSP) & Managed Service Providers (MSP).

Where SUSE sells directly to an IHV who manufactures equipment (e.g. servers, mainframes, laptops or desktops) and/or creates solutions (such as bundled offerings) which contains SUSE products/subscriptions. IHVs sell their equipment and/or solutions through their own channel/eco-system.
Where SUSE's software and/or subscriptions are part of an offering provided by a partner, such as MRI scanners/medical equipment, etc.
The Services RTM is made up of offerings such as Premium Support, Consulting Services and Training Services

An arrangement or classification of products according to relative importance or inclusiveness. This hierarchy is captured in Salesforce and is directly related to the recognition of revenue. This product hierarchy has an associated mapping, which include internal and external reportings of revenue as well as pipeline/forecasting of that revenue. The classifications are: Business Unit/Solutions, Portfolio, Brand, SUSE Product Family, Product Family, External Reporting Finance.

This is the top layer of the product hierarchy as found in Salesforce CPQ and is associated with a product offering/part number. This identifies the various foundational products. Example: BCL, ECM, Edge, SUSE AI, Services.

A layer of the product hierarchy directly auto-mapped under the Business Unit (soon to be renamed Solution) as found in Salesforce CPQ and is associated with a product offering/part number. This groups together and reports like products found within one of the identified foundational products. Example: SUSE Linux. SUSE Management, Rancher by SUSE, SUSE AI, Edge, SUSE Services.

A layer of the product hierarchy directly auto-mapped under the Portfolio as found in Salesforce CPQ and is associated with a product offering/part number. This groups together and reports like products found within one of the identified Portfolios. This reflects the brand strategy for internal and external recognition of SUSEâ€™s products. Example: SUSE Multi-Linux Support, Rancher Prime, SUSE Multi-Linux Management, SUSE Virtualization, etc.

This field drives the auto-mapping of the product hierarchy up to the Business Unit (soon to be Solution) in Salesforce CPQ.A layer of the product hierarchy directly auto-mapped under the Brand as found in Salesforce CPQ and is associated with a product offering/part number. This groups together like products found within one of the identified Brands.This identifies and reports the grouping that the internal revenue recognition is associated with for funding future development of those products. Example: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server, SUSE Liberty Linux, SUSE Security, SUSE Storage, SUSE Virtualization, Edge Platform, SUSE Rancher Prime, etc.

A layer of the product hierarchy directly auto-mapped under the SUSE Product Family as found in Salesforce CPQ and is associated with a product offering/part number. This groups together like products found within one of the identified SUSE Product Families. This identifies and reports the grouping that the internal forecasting/pipeline revenue is associated with for the CRO and sales targets.

A layer of the product hierarchy directly auto-mapped under the Product Family as found in Salesforce CPQ and is associated with a product offering/part number. This groups together like products found within one of the identified SUSE Product Families. This identifies and reports the revenue externally for products in these groupings. Today that is identified as Core or Emerging.
A software solution or service offered by the company represented by a part number with a List Price intended to generate revenue.

BCL is Business Core Linux Products. This represents SUSE Linux Enterprise and Management Products as well as SUSE Engineering. This is related to types of products. CRO is the application of generating revenue of BCL, but CRO does not own BCL.
A secure, adaptable and easy-to-manage Linux server platform that allows developers and administrators to deploy business-critical workloads on-premises, in the cloud and at the edge.
